parameters: \pop[2]Me and Kyron move to the other side of the kitchen for privacy.
\pop[2]More and more people are arriving, and the energy levels are increasing.
\pop[2]Isaac definitely knew how to throw a party, I'll give him credit for that.
\pop[2]But I start to wonder who all of these people are.
\pop[2]He's never talked about any friends outside of this group.
Kinda wish we did stuff like this on the colony.
\i[3]"You didn't party on the colony? Sounds boring."
\i[3]"Sounds lonely. This is kind of a social life staple."
\i[3]"You didn't party on the colony? Sounds boring."
\pop[3]Well, we had gatherings, but not like this.
Mostly campfire stuff - and a couple songs on guitar.
That's where I learned how to play "raise your hand".
\i[3]"Sounds lonely. This is kind of a social life staple."
\pop[3]Yeah. Not much room for a social life on the colony.
If we had some spare time, it was at the end of the night.
We'd do campfires, and play games like "raise your hand".
\pop[3]Other than that, it was just work, sleep, repeat.
Have I ever told you how things work on the colony?
\i[3]"Not really. It's still a mystery to me."
\i[3]"Not really. It's still a mystery to me."
\pop[3]Well, every week we'd get an allowance of food and water.
It was entirely dependent on how much work we did.
The more we contributed, the more we got back.
\pop[3]If you slacked off, they could deny you the essentials.
So it creates this atmosphere of hard work being necessary.
It definitely is, though. Running a colony takes a \c[14]lot\c[0] of work.
\pop[3]So it makes sense that they'd reward the hardest workers.
I was always at the top of the list. Guess I loved to help out.
But when you live out there, you can't really do anything else.
\pop[3]Some would say the same about city life, actually.
You're all under \c[23]Argus\c[0]' thumb, whether you like it or not.
Gotta live life the way \c[14]they\c[0] demand it, or suffer the losses.
\pop[3]At least in the city, you can be depressed in style.
A lot easier to put on a mask when you have all this stuff to do.
Did I tell you I went to that big tower everyone keeps talking about?
Like climbing the tallest tree in the world.
I could practically see my colony from up there.
They even had a part where the floor was transparent.
Good thing I'm not scared of heights. Would've had a heart attack.
\pop[3]Oh, and then I went to this store that sold \c[14]only\c[0] guitars.
I hooked one up to a big speaker, and got to play it.
People started watching, saying I was talented.
\pop[2]He's clearly excited to be talking about all of this.
\pop[2]I can hear it in his voice, and the pacing of his words.
\pop[2]The "cold shoulder" he had is definitely warming up.
\pop[2]Or, it could just be the alcohol...
\i[5]"I'm really glad you're enjoying life in the city."
\i[2]"Talented? You'll have to serenade me sometime."
\i[6]Hope you're ready for all the fame to come your way."
\i[0]"I wish your friends could do those things, too..."
\i[5]"I'm really glad you're enjoying life in the city."
\pop[3]Yeah. Still can't believe I'm the first.
But lately, I haven't gotten to do much.
We're basically glued together, after all.
\pop[3]I could think of worse people to be stuck with, though...
\i[2]"Talented? You'll have to serenade me sometime."
Wait, is that the right expression?
\i[1]"Guess it depends what your intentions are."
\i[1]"Guess it depends what your intentions are."
\i[6]Hope you're ready for all the fame to come your way."
\pop[3]Born ready. Trust me, I played a lot of guitar.
Too bad I couldn't bring mine with me, though.
\pop[3]They made us travel light when we came to the city.
It's a shame, because I would've loved to show it to you.
\i[0]"I wish your friends could do those things, too..."
That dream of yours is getting closer and closer.
If \c[10]Hermes\c[0] actually follows through, I mean.
You have \c[14]so\c[0] much junk food in the city.
Definitely think I put on a few pounds by now.
\i[3]"Where did you get it from? Why do you wear it?"
\i[3]"Where did you get it from? Why do you wear it?"
\pop[3]I could ask the same thing about \c[14]your\c[0] wardrobe.
Been rocking that outfit since the day I met you.
In fact, come to think of it, everyone has...
\pop[3]Either way, it was just a gift given to me on the colony.
That's how we'd show affection between friends.
A special gift, with a special meaning.
\pop[3]I heard in the city, you just give each other money.
But I think this is better. A \c[14]lot\c[0] more personal.
\pop[2]I ask if this "friend" of his is protesting in the town square.
\pop[2]He immediately locks up, like I've struck a nerve.
\pop[3]I actually wanted to talk to you about my past.
But I think we should take it to the bedroom?
It's not stuff that I want anybody overhearing.
\i[2]"Oh? Taking things to the next level with me?"
\i[2]"Oh? Taking things to the next level with me?"
\pop[2]He tilts his head toward the bedrooms.
\pop[2]I decide we should go to mine, and start leading the way.
\pop[2]When we get to my bedroom, I close the door behind us.
\pop[2]I know he wanted his privacy, and I had no problem providing.
\pop[2]It reminds me of the airplane chat we had. I hope everything is alright.
\pop[3]Sorry, but you never know who's listening in.
You're... You're pretty close with Isaac, right?
\pop[3]Right. I remember that coming up in the group chat.
I wanted to talk to him about something, but I don't know how.
\i[5]"Yeah. He's one of my best friends."
\i[5]"Yeah. He's one of my best friends."
\pop[3]Kinda figured as much. You moved in with him, after all.
There's something I want to ask him, but I don't know how.
\i[3]"What do you want to talk to him about?"
\i[3]"What do you want to talk to him about?"
\pop[3]Well, you got me thinking about my past.
Did I ever tell you about my parents...?
\i[3]"You said you never really knew them."
\i[3]"You said you never really knew them."
\pop[2]I notice that he immediately changes the topic away from his collar.
\pop[2]Whatever it meant, and whoever gave it to him, must be a touchy subject.
\pop[3]They passed away shortly after I was born.
But in the colony, everybody is family.
So the loss never really hit me.
\pop[3]I actually \c[14]hated\c[0] them. Or at least, the idea of them.
\c[14]They\c[0] were the reason that I was stuck on the colony, after all.
But now that I'm in the city, I see things a bit differently.
\pop[2]I think we're all seeing things a bit different, lately...
\pop[3]While I was growing up, the other colonists told me \c[14]one\c[0] thing.
They told me that my parents celebrated the anniversary of their defection.
\i[3]"They must've been happy to leave the city behind."
\i[3]"They must've been happy to leave the city behind."
\pop[3]Look how hard we're fighting to get back \c[14]in\c[0].
We needed the help of \c[10]Cipher\c[0] and \c[10]Hermes\c[0] to even stand a chance.
What was so terrible that they needed to run away, and force this life on me?
\i[3]"Good question. It's almost impossible to guess."
\i[3]"Good question. It's almost impossible to guess."
But not impossible to find out.
\pop[3]\c[23]Argus\c[0] \c[14]must\c[0] keep tabs on people who leave the city.
There's gotta be some kind of record.
\pop[3]But that's where things get a bit complicated.
Normally, it's be hard to track down specific people.
\i[3]"Unless you knew the date they left..."
\i[3]"Unless you knew the date they left..."
\pop[3]I wanted to ask Isaac if he could look into them for me.
You know, at his follow-up interview?
Or maybe selfish is the word I'm looking for.
I just feel like it could give me some closure.
\i[3]"It's normal to be curious about your family history."
\i[3]"It's normal to be curious about your family history."
\i[3]\c[23]"Sometimes you have to be selfish in order to get what you want."\c[0]
\i[3]\c[23]"Sometimes you have to be selfish in order to get what you want."\c[0]
But we all know they're a good person. They want what's best.
Maybe selfish is just a term thrown around by people who hate to lose.
\pop[3]Like I said, it's always easier to blame your misfortune on somebody else.
Especially when you don't understand them, or give them even ground.
If I learned more about my parents, it could answer all my questions.
\pop[3]You know, like why they left the city...
Why they condemned their bloodline. \c[14]My\c[0] bloodline.
I may not have deserved a life in the city, but I \c[14]deserve\c[0] an answer.
\i[3]"Isaac will definitely help you out. I know it."
\i[3]"Isaac will definitely help you out. I know it."
I just didn't want to get greedy.
But I know theres no real  reason.
I was just in the right place at the right time.
\pop[3]Is that all it takes to change the course of history, then?
Just one string of coincidences after another?
\i[3]"You have to sprinkle a bit of conviction in there, as well."
\i[3]"You have to sprinkle a bit of conviction in there, as well."
\pop[2]He laughs, and nudges me on the shoulder.
\pop[3]I won't forget your part in this, Delta.
But I guess I'll let you get back to business.
This is gonna be a busy night for you, after all.
\pop[2]He starts to leave the room, but then turns back around.
\pop[3]I know we talked about sharing a bed and stuff.
But all this talk about the past was definitely a mood-killer.
\pop[2]But it seems like the mood wasn't \c[14]entirely\c[0] killed...
\pop[2]He steps forward, and pulls me in close by the collar of my shirt.
\pop[3]You've flirted with me at like, every opportunity.
I don't want you to think that I'm not interested.
So this'll have to tide you over for now...
\pop[2]Taking a couple steps forward, I'm pinned against the wall.
\pop[2]He gives me a piercing gaze, our eyes locked on each other.
\pop[2]Before I know it, our lips are locked together, too.
\pop[2]I grab him by the collar, and switch our positions, taking little effort.
\pop[2]We kiss, over and over, as I pin him against the wall in return.
\pop[2]This goes on for a blissful eternity, until he slowly pulls back.
\pop[3]I can taste that booze on your lips.
\pop[2]He runs his hand along the side of my face, and smiles.
\pop[2]With his hand still resting on my face, he gives me one more kiss.
\pop[2]He leaves the room, his stride both confident and happy.
\pop[2]Now \c[14]that\c[0] was a good start to this New Year's Eve party...
\pop[2]Just like I anticipated, it'd be a night to remember.
\pop[2]Eager to keep the good times rolling, I head back toward the kitchen.
\pop[2]I can't help but think about Kyron, though. I hope he gets what he wanted.
\pop[2]Not knowing about your family must be difficult. Even \c[14]I'm\c[0] kind of curious about them.
\pop[2]I guess that's a topic for another day, though.
\pop[2]Right now? It's time to keep partying.
\pop[2]He opens his arms, offering me a hug, and I accept.
\pop[2]We give each other a couple pats on the back, and pull away.
\pop[3]Bet you never thought you'd be doing that with a \c[10]zero\c[0], huh?
But you know what they say. There's a first time for everything.
\pop[2]With a smile, he leaves the room.
\pop[2]I look at the time, and there's still a while until first midnight.
\pop[2]With that in mind, I head back toward the kitchen.
\pop[2]I can't help but think about Kyron, though. I hope he gets what he wanted.
\pop[2]Not knowing about your family must be difficult. Even \c[14]I'm\c[0] kinda curious about them.
\pop[2]I guess that's a topic for another day, though.
\pop[2]Right now? It's time to keep partying.
